data.title: Good Small Nice Place
data.text: Amelia's is a small friendly family owned place. The food is good and reasonable price. The wait staff is friendly. They have live music on Friday nights which is nice.

data.title: Dinner on a Saturday evening
data.text: Just don't go here. The bistek a la Mexicana was so tough it needed a jackhammer to cut it into pieces. The chips are thick and very hard. The salsa is only just okay. My husband got one of the combination platters and the meats they used for his meal was tough and flavorless. This is possibly the worst Mexican restaurant I have been to in years. If you're in rowlett, and you want to have a decent Mexican meal, go to the dalrock and I-30 intersection and eat at Alejandro's.

data.title: An average restaurant
data.text: We ate at Amelia's on a early Friday evening. The staff were quite attentive as it was not that busy at that time. I had the Bistek A La Mexicana. The beef part was very good. It was very tender with a red sauce. It is also quite a spicy dish which I liked very much. I opted to get fried potatoes instead of a salad. The potatoes were not at all tasty - not seasoned, just large sliced potatoes that were fried. The rice and beans were just ok. My husband got the Chile Relleno with ground meat. He has lots of experience having Chile Relleno dishes in various Mexican restaurants and he said this was not good at all. He ate it because he was hungry but it was not flavorful at all. It is also rather dark in the restaurant and one has got to be seated in a brighter area to see the menu! The chips they served when we first got seated were very hard on the teeth. All in all, this restaurant may be ok if you know which dishes to get but overall there are many more Mexican restaurants out there that are far better for the money.

data.title: slow service and cheap food
data.text: The inside is very inviting but on a slow sat lunch it took almost 10 minutes to get our ice tea. The food was barely ok and if the taco meat had been seasoned it would helped. The chips tasted store bought and the sause was poor at best. I do not recommend this rest but at least the prices were cheap.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: They ignored us at the door, didn't bring us chips ! The ticket took forever..too dark to see the menu.

data.title: Nice little surprise
data.text: Located in a strip mall in Rowlett near several other dining establishments, we thought we would give this little Mexican place a try. Service was "okay", not impressive but not bad either. The place is on the small side but was nice and clean. A basket of chips and salsa were brought to our table - chips are thick and fresh, salsa was smoky and tasty. The peach and pomegranate margaritas were a hit! We ordered sopes and tortas - all made to order. We were very impressed with the menu and will back back soon to try breakfast and some Tex Mex dishes. Very reasonable prices. Go for the frozen margaritas!

data.title: Good food and a nice atmosphere
data.text: Food prices here are very reasonable. Good selection as well. Chips a little too thick for me. I had 3 enchilada plate, very good, maybe a lil too much cheese but didn't take away from the taste of the enchiladas at all. Will definitely go back.

data.title: Very good authentic Mexican food.
data.text:
I am becoming a regular at Amelia's.  Besides the proximity to our home, the very reasonable prices, and the friendly staff, there is the food.  I have not had a single item that I have not liked and our latest trip there was no exception.  

My wife got her usual enchiladas but like always she asks for substitutions.  It came out perfect and there was not an upcharge for the change.  I ordered the bistek with peppers, onions, and cheese.  In short, it was incredible.  I often get the bistek with the red sauce but after tasting the salsa, I decided that I did not want to kill my taste buds with excessive heat.  A great decision since the dinner had a touch of heat but a small enough amount that my wife who does not like spicy food stole several pieces of meat off my plate.  Along with the bistek were the sides of roasted potatoes, homemade refried beans, Spanish rice, and a small salad.  The rice is merely fair but the beans were very good as were the potatoes.  What really surprised me was the salad.  It was basically a small serving of lettuce but they served a small amount of pico on it and a nice scoop of guacamole.  I immediately took the chopped peppers off the salad but without them, the salad was very good.  It had a hint of lime from the pico as well as the onions and tomato combination.  The guac was definitely fresh.  There were chunks of avocado in it.

I don't think I have had a bad item here and have had several items that are exceptional.  It starts with the chips (thicker and more solid than you get at most places) and a very good (hot!) salsa and goes from there to the rest of the meal.  Two notes.  First, they do not have Coke products, just Pepsi.  Second, on Friday nights they have live music which can get quite loud.

The enchiladas were less than $9, the bistek was $14.  We got out for less than $36 including the tip.  And if we were not as hungry as we were (and we did make pigs of ourselves) there would have been leftovers to take home with us.

The atmosphere is casual but the food is anything but.

data.title: I'd go back
data.text: Great food!!  Service has been good for the most part. Love Love Love when they have Doug playing music.  He makes the atmosphere great!!

data.title: Bistek Ranchero wow in more ways than one
data.text:
I had been told how good the bisket Mexicana was and I was seriously going to try it when I asked the waiter how hot was it.  He warned me that it can be spicy and suggested the Bistek Ranchero instead.  A great suggestion for a great dinner.  It is very tender seasoned beef served with a red sauce, onions and peppers.  Unlike the Mexicana, it does not have jalapeno peppers in it.  A good thing, it was hot.  Delicious (I was wiping off the plate for the last little bits) but it was almost borderline too hot for my taste.  A suggestion for anyone tempted to get the Mexicana, if you find that the salsa is warm, stick with the Ranchero.

My wife had the salad which was obviously delicious since she finished the whole thing too.  There is an upcharge of $2 to add refried beans to it, but even so, it is still less than $10.  I had a bite of the shell that serves as a bowl to hold it.  A bit heavier than the ones at most Mexican restaurants, Still, very good.

On weekends we found that they now have a performer playing middle of the road music like the Eagles.  A nice addition but we had to move a bit away from the stage since it was a bit loud.

data.title: Won't go back
data.text: Was really looking forward to this place, but food was awful.  Had spinach quesadillas, which was made with canned spinach...ewww. Even the salsa was bad. Low prices due to poor quality. No thanks!

data.title: Very good Mexican restaurant
data.text:
Amelia's is in the same strip center as a Chinese restaurant, a Greek restaurant, and a Little Caesar's pizza.  Four four restaurants so close together, all are more than acceptable entries in the "where should we eat out tonight" contest in Rowlett.

This was our first trip to Amelia's after seeing it for quite a while.  We had been told it was an upscale, somewhat expensive restaurant by friends so we had been putting it off.  A mistake.  Prices are actually quite reasonable with most of the entrees in the $10.00 range or a little bit less whcih puts it middle of the road for prices.

Food.  My wife and I started off with a guacamole appetizer.  Three scoops of quac served over a bed of lettuce and tomatoes with a bit of cheese added.  Not as spicy as some of the guac I have had but definitely freshly made.  I would give it a good to very good.

The chips were interesting.  Much thicker than most of the local restaurants served.  Different but not bad.  Two of us finished off the better part of a basket of them.  The chips came with salsa which I liked.  It was a bit hotter than what most restaurants serve but not exceedingly so.  Great flavor.  My wife thought it was a bit too hot for her taste.

The menu is a collection of basic Tex-Mex recipes with a few interesting additions thrown in to the mix like a steak covered with cheese and onions.  I was seriously tempted to try it but it had a "hot" indicator by it so I chickened out despite the waiter saying that it was about the same degree of heat as in the salsa.

My wife had the cheese enchiladas with a red sauce, her judge of good Tex-Mex.  She really liked it.  I ordered the combo plate of an enchilada, gordito, and taco.  One nice thing about Amelias is the variety.  There is a white sauce, a red sauce, and a queso.  But what was really interesting were the choices of filling.  Besides the usual ground beef and chicken, there are green pepper and egg, beans, cheese, cactus, beef fajita, chicken fajita, brisket,  spicy pork, barbacoa, Guiso de Puerco Bisteck (can't remember what that one was), and Papas con Chorizo.  I decided to try for variety with the chicken enchilada with white sauce, the beef brisket taco, and the steak fajita gordito.  The chicken enchilada was stuffed with chicken but the sauce was very bland and thin.  I would give that a fair.  The steak gordito was more of a street taco, well done meat filling a pocket taco.  Lots of flavor.  It was what I would call a classic street taco.  Very good.  The real gem was the taco.  It was a soft flour taco stuffed with a ton of shredded, very juicy meat.  Flavor was very mild but when I added the lettuce, tomato, and pico that was served on the side, it was delicious.

We got there a bit before the crowd showed up getting there about 6 PM on a Saturday.  By 6:45 the restaurant was packed with every table but one filled.  That might account for the service.  It started off exemplary but by the time we were getting ready to leave, we could tell the servers were a bit rushed.  Still, our server was very personable and gave us several suggestions and comments about the menu.

Overall, a good eating experience and a place we will return to, in part because it is right around the corner from us.  And I do want to try that steak.

One suggestion, the first two tables near the door are a bit drafty when the door is opened.  I would suggest sitting back a bit- especially in the winter.

data.title: Tasty Mexican Food
data.text:
We have been to Amelia's Cocina for dinner many times and never been disappointed.  We love the salsa.  The chips are made from corn, not flour as another reviewer mentioned, but they are a thicker, crunchy chip.  We still enjoyed them! The atmosphere is pleasant with Latin music in the background, unless you happen to go on a weekend evening, when they have had an Elvis impersonator singing.  I prefer Latin music in a Mexican restaurant.  I would be pleased if they made the restaurant brighter by opening some blinds or adding a little more light.  The service there is always friendly and good.  I also WISH they would open up the floor for some Latin dancing on weekends!
My husband enjoys the Bistek Flameado, although the fried potatoes that come with it are a bit greasy.  The rice and beans are good.  Guacamole is fresh and delicious! I've gotten the Pechuga Mexicana, or Mexican chicken breast many times, and since I don't care for beans, I ask for their Nopales, or cactus which is cooked in a spicy tomato sauce.  Yummy! A plus, they have not charged for substitution.  I'd love to see fresh made flour and corn tortillas.  It is confusing that they have a tortilleria in Garland, yet their tortillas here in Rowlett do not seem that fresh.  (I get fresh tortillas all the time from Central Market and they are MUCH better.) Really fresh tortillas, add a little light, and keep the Latin music, that would give them that 5 star rating!

data.title: Excellent Service and Food
data.text:
The service is great at this small restaurant in the Dallas hamlet of Rowlett. And the food is wonderful as is the presentation, which will make wonder why is this place in a strip mall in Rowlett, Texas?? I don't know why, but I am happy there are there. The lunch selections are bountiful, especially the salads. The day we went we had Chicken Taco Salad, which was crisp and tasty.
My companion had fish tacos, which were yummy. The chips are homemade and the salsa is fresh and not too hot!! You have to try this place the price is moderate and the menu has selections to fit any budget.

data.title: great lunch and prices
data.text: Quick, Good, and great price for lunch. Love Love Love their chips! We go all the time for lunch and dinner. For lunch the servers should drop the check,so you can get out a little faster.

data.title: The food is very good
data.text: The food is actually very good Tex Mex food. Generous portions and very tasty overall. The only thing that we did not like at all was their chips and salsa. They make their chips from flour tortillas which we thought was just horrible. Very Very tough to eat without breaking a tooth.  That would be the only thing that I would change here.  But on the up side, you save a lot of calories by not eating the chips! ;-D

data.title: Great environment!
data.text: First time I went to Amelias, I was impressed with the food, prices and drink specials, however the service was horrible.  Now, the bad servers are gone and this place is great to go and have a meal.  On the weekends there is someone playing music solo, its very relaxing and a great place to go.  I love the food options, you can eat as little or as much as you'd like and the prices are excellent!  If you're not a mexican food snob, I highly recommend trying Amelia's.

data.title: Amelia's Rocks!!
data.text: Great sit down no rush Mexican dinner. Enchilada plates are my fave, Fajitas are better than most of the chain places you go to!! Great service and another good spot for a party and groups. Give it a try <"))><

data.title: Used to be our favorite!
data.text: We used to eat here atleast twice a month and the last 3 visits were terrible. The beef fajita meat has been really chewy and used to be some of the best I've had. Queso runny and had to ask for another one. Service is really bad but food seems to have a good wait time. Something is just off . Im sure we will go back. We are just taking some time off in hopes it will go back to the way it used to be.

data.title: Used to be our favorite but now we don't go here...
data.text:
I hate to say but we gave Amelia's 2 very good try's in the past 3 months but the quality of the service was very poor--even disinterested--and the food was mediocre at best.  We have been very disappointed that the quality has gone down, but we have other good restaurants to go try now in Rowlett!

It's too bad but we no longer come to Amelia's for our TexMex meals.
